sentences.english: Some of you have come fresh from narrow jail cells.
sentences.chinese: 你们有些人刚刚走出狭小的牢房。
心胸狭小的人道人长短。

sentences.english: They live in tight little self-enclosed worlds.
sentences.chinese: 他们活在一个狭小而自我封闭的世界里。

sentences.english: I don't want to be trapped in my tiny little world, wasting the precious times.
sentences.chinese: 再不愿陷在这狭小的天地，耗费如此宝贵的韶华。

sentences.english: If you are cramped for space, a screened-off corner of a room will work well.
sentences.chinese: 如果房间很狭小，隔出房间的一角就行了。

sentences.english: Content to bloom in native bower, Although the place be small.
sentences.chinese: 不嫌自己园亭狭小，愿意努力开花。

sentences.english: These areas are densely populated but geographically quite small.
sentences.chinese: 这些地区人口稠密，但是地理上十分狭小。

sentences.english: I met her in a small, untidy coffeehouse on the outskirts of London.
sentences.chinese: 我是在伦敦郊外的一个狭小凌乱的咖啡馆遇见她的。

sentences.english: His face was small and ugly.
The party-government began in 1924, but on a small scale.
sentences.chinese: 党治从1924年就开始了，不过范围狭小。

sentences.english: Sometimes, the narrowminded people make me frustrated.
sentences.chinese: 胸怀狭小的人，有时使我气馁。

sentences.english: I threw arow of arrows, which narrowly passed the narrow-minded man's eyebrows.
sentences.chinese: 我掷了一排箭，箭紧擦心胸狭小的人的眉毛而过。

sentences.english: How can so much creativity be confined into one tiny area of the city?
sentences.chinese: 城市中狭小的一隅怎能凝聚如此丰富的创造力？

sentences.english: San Marino may be small, but it has a lot of culture and history.
sentences.chinese: 圣马利诺也许狭小，但却拥有丰富的历史与文化。

sentences.english: And please don't keep animals caged in small spaces or tied up.
sentences.chinese: 请不要把动物关在狭小空间内或绑起来。

sentences.english: She maneuvered her car into a narrow parking space with ease.
sentences.chinese: 她轻松地把车驶进了一个狭小的车位。

definition: to hold/to contain/to accommodate/to tolerate (different opinions)
